reviews.review: FIVE STARS. The storyline is full of twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat. It's funny, I mean really funny- and does so not by telling cheap jokes, but by telling smart jokes.
Excellent movie. Like watching a live version of clue. Excellent cast!!!!

Contrary to the movie previews aired on television that portrayed this movie as a comedy, it is not primarily a comedy.  It is more like a Hercule Poirot detective movie.  Great cast and respectable performances from all, even though it did seem that some were delivering their lines with "tongue in cheek", and Daniel Craig appeared to be recovering from a hangover throughout the movie.

We saw it for the second time with friends on New Year's Eve and enjoyed it just as much as tahe first time.  Keeps you guessing until the end and beyond.  Daniel Craig is great as the detective, everyone does an excellent job.

Best thing about this mystery was that I couldn't guess the ending, exactly. The writing was superb and included a lot of twists and turns. Great star-studded cast. I'm sure they all had fun with these over-the-top characters.Go see it!!!

It is an amazing way to explain how hard could it be to find out something that's in front of you and it gives you slow clues about what's going on because it's like the hardest round of the CLUE game.

I absolutely loved this film and it's for for sure one of the best movies of 2019
AWESOMETACULOR! Excellent cast! Excellent writing! Going into my blu Ray collection!

Excellent ensemble cast. Daniel Craig was wonderful, as was almost everyone else, One of the few movies these days that wasnt biased with the political jokes, instead making fun of both SJWs and the Alt-Right equally. The murder mystery itself couldve been stronger, honestly that was the movies only downfall. When it ends youre left thinking, the story was good, but it couldve been so much better. Yes, you find out what really happened halfway through the movie, but you expect the second half to be just as good yet it ends up being weaker than the first half for sure. Definitely see the movie, but its not necessary to see it in a theater. Ill add that as someone who lives in Boston, Im so glad they filmed this in Massachusetts. Hollywood rarely captures the vibe and people but this movie does. Chris Evans was born and raised in greater Boston and I suspect he helped capture the authenticity.
Great who-dun-it. Second time I saw it.
